tasks.title: Identify Stakeholders
tasks.description: Identify 5 different categories of stakeholders across product life cycle stages.

completeness.description: Identify stakeholders from all five categories, especially Environment Stakeholders, Past Stakeholders, and Future Stakeholders in the answers.
Identify stakeholders from different stages of the product life cycle.
Mention which stakeholders should be prioritized.

quality.description: high quality means that the stakeholder categories are diverse and go through all stages of the product life cycle
low quality means that the stakeholder categories are not diverse and go through less than 3 stages of the product life cycle

presentation.description: Present stakeholder with information such as title, relationship with the product,description, category, and stages.

tasks.title: Analyze Stakeholder Information
tasks.description: Identify the needs, interests, and relationships of the stakeholders.

completeness.description: mention the revelant needs of stakeholders.
Explore stakeholder relationships (whether aligned or contrasting).

quality.description: Ensure needs are specific, measurable, and relevant to each stakeholder.
Think of the need changed over time.

presentation.description: Formulate the needs of stakeholders in the recommended structure. See 'needs_structure' in the 'knowledge_base' section of this file.

tasks.title: Translate to Requirements
tasks.description: Translate the stakeholder's information into requirement statements.

completeness.description: mention the requirement statements in the recommended structure.

quality.description: Ensure requirements are clear, concise, and actionable.
Verify that requirements align with identified stakeholder needs.

presentation.description: Formulate the requirement statements in the recommended structure. The recommended structure can be found in the 'requirement_statement_format' section of this file.

stakeholder_categories.name: Environment Stakeholders
stakeholder_categories.description: People or entities that influence the landscape and environment where the system or product operates. Examples include city planners, regulators, and urban developers.

stakeholder_categories.name: Direct Interactors
stakeholder_categories.description: People or groups who interact directly with the system or product, such as end users, retailers, and service providers.

stakeholder_categories.name: Subsystem Interactors
stakeholder_categories.description: People responsible for building or managing subsystems, like component suppliers and maintenance services.

stakeholder_categories.name: Past Stakeholders
stakeholder_categories.description: People who previously interacted with the system or product, such as former customers who provide insights based on past experiences.

stakeholder_categories.name: Future Stakeholders
stakeholder_categories.description: New stakeholders who may interact with the system or product in the future, such as potential customers or groups interested in sustainable or alternative solutions.

product_life_cycle_stages.name: Research on users, market, and regulations
product_life_cycle_stages.description: Focus on understanding the needs of the target users, current market trends, and the regulations that may affect the product.

product_life_cycle_stages.name: Technical, operational, and functional concept
product_life_cycle_stages.description: Development of the technical, operational, and functional aspects of the product, including its design and features.

product_life_cycle_stages.name: Goals and objectives for the product
product_life_cycle_stages.description: Establish the goals and objectives the product must meet, including performance, safety, and cost considerations.

product_life_cycle_stages.name: Risk analysis and function formation
product_life_cycle_stages.description: Identify potential risks associated with the product and develop strategies to mitigate those risks.

product_life_cycle_stages.name: Detailed technical design
product_life_cycle_stages.description: Creation of the detailed technical specifications for the product.

product_life_cycle_stages.name: Manufacturing
product_life_cycle_stages.description: The process of manufacturing the product, including the selection of materials and assembly processes.

product_life_cycle_stages.name: Use and maintenance
product_life_cycle_stages.description: The operational phase where the product is used by customers, along with the maintenance processes required to ensure its longevity.

product_life_cycle_stages.name: Recycle
product_life_cycle_stages.description: The end-of-life phase of the product, focusing on how the product can be recycled or disposed of sustainably.

needs_structure.description: The needs of stakeholders should be formulated using the following structure:
needs_structure.structure: [A user] needs [need] in order to accomplish [goal].
needs_structure.example: [Alieda, a multitasking, tech-savvy mother of 2] needs [to drive her two children to school quickly by a bike] in order to [spend more time working on her startup].

interests_definition.description: Interests refer to preferences of stakeholders, which are not mandatory to satisfy like needs.
interests_definition.example: For example, a stakeholder might have an interest in eco-friendly materials, but it is not a required feature.

relationships.description: Relationships between stakeholders can be aligned (working towards the same goal) or contrasting (with differing or opposing goals).
relationships.example: For instance, a component supplier may prioritize cost-saving, while a user may prioritize quality, leading to contrasting stakeholder relationships.

requirement_statement_format.description: Requirement statements should be formulated using the following structure:

components.name: Condition
components.description: The condition under which the function must be achieved

components.name: Constraints
components.description: The limitations or restrictions that must be adhered to while fulfilling the requirement

requirement_statement_format.example: The system [Function: shall provide real-time traffic updates] [Condition: when the user is navigating] [Constraints: without compromising battery life or data usage].
